intro: Teloxys ambrosioides, commonly known as the Mexican rue, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a strong, pungent odor when crushed. Teloxys ambrosioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
